channel.title: Will Java ever be capable of
channel.description:
Will Java ever be capable of creating a .exe?
I cam currently trying to learn C++, and the only thing stopping me from moving to Java is the fact that it can't create .exe files (at leaste I think). I don't know why this bothers me, as once the program starts it doesn't matter, but it does.
So, will it?

item.title: Will Java ever be capable of
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“Zach1188, post:29, topic:15717”][quote author=1337h4x link=topic=23457.msg275805#msg275805 date=1159418263]
Unless you want to get a job and stuff.
[/quote]
Sorry if I’m wrong, but don’t a lot of large compainies use Java? I have seen a fair amount of programs that have an .exe that run a .jar file that’s in another folder. The rest is written in Java.[/quote]

Many large companies use java now, and many more are going towards using java, its a good language to learn

Read full topic

item.title: Will Java ever be capable of
item.dc:creator: @1337h4x 1337h4x
item.description:
@1337h4x wrote:

moparisthebest:

Most likely not, VB is a useless wast of time.

Hell yes, I was waiting for someone to say that.

Stick with java, what diffrence does it make if it’s in a jar or exe.
Unless you want to get a job and stuff.

Read full topic
item.source: Will Java ever be capable of

item.title: Will Java ever be capable of
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“Drunk On Java, post:26, topic:15717”][quote author=moparisthebest link=topic=23457.msg274706#msg274706 date=1159305142]
Coding a GUI in java is really easy, if you want an even easier drag and drop experiance try netbeans

Again, about the win32 API, DON’T USE IT, there are many free open source implementations of GUI’s out there that will work on both linux and windows (maybe mac? idk) one that I know of is GTK+ for example
[/quote]
You know any linux programs that can port VB6 to linux?
I have tried MonoDevelop but not liking C#. (Too much of a copy of Java)[/quote]

Most likely not, VB is a useless wast of time.

Read full topic

item.title: Will Java ever be capable of
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

[quote=“Zach1188, post:23, topic:15717”][quote author=moparisthebest link=topic=23457.msg274330#msg274330 date=1159269194]
Just stick with java, there isn’t a whole lot you can’t do with java that you can do with C++.

If you do go with C++, just use smart coding and don’t use the windows API or anything like that so that your code will compile on both windows and linux
[/quote]
Ok then, thanks. Java it is.

Is coding a GUI in Java easier than in C++? Because I’m having a hard time with Win32 API.[/quote]Mmmm, I had code my GUI’s in Java. It’s more of a personal preference, I think.

Like, I guess you’re using Visual C++? They’re pretty simple, from my VB experience.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Zach1188 Zach1188
item.description:
@Zach1188 wrote:

lolpaladin:

In essence, you’re asking to attach the entire jre to a single application.

Oh, I see.

So should I just keep going for C++ to make native applications (not just for Windows, but Linux too)?

Read full topic

item.title: Will Java ever be capable of
item.dc:creator: @Zach1188 Zach1188
item.description:
@Zach1188 wrote:

I didn’t really mean just to make it .exe files (even though I made it look that way). I meant is there a way to make it native for either Mac, Linux, or Windows, so people don’t need to have JDK just to use it.

Read full topic

item.source: Will Java ever be capable of

item.title: Will Java ever be capable of
item.dc:creator: @Stork Stork
item.description:
@Stork wrote:

Yeah, compiling java class files to native code more or less defeats the point of coding in java. You lose the VM and thus error handling and you lose inter-operability.
If you want native code, learn VB.

So saying ‘will java ever be capable of’ is inappropriate. It’d really be a disadvantage.

Read full topic
item.source: Will Java ever be capable of
